com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn

Class ParametrisedNeuralNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn.ParametrisedNeuralNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<double[],double[]>, Stringable, VectorFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BainNeuralNetwork

    public abstract class ParametrisedNeuralNetwork
extends PrototypeBase
implements VectorFunction, Stringable

    A wrapper for neural network implementations whose configuration is defined by a set of labelled numeric parameters. The wrapper specifies methods for constructing the network, and implements the VectorFunction interface to represent applying input to the network and reading the associated output.

    The wrapper supports the notion of neuron and synapse types. A type is defined by a specific configuration (a set of values for some parameters), and a neuron or synapse that references that type will adopt that configuration. See ParametrisedGeneType.getParamsType() for more information.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfig

        public abstract NNConfig<?,?> getConfig()

        The base or general configuration for the neural network.

      • addNeuronType

        public int addNeuronType(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> config)
        Add a neuron type to this neural network.
        Parameters:
        config - Neuron model-specific configuration parameters, if applicable.
        Returns:
        The index of the new neuron type in this neural network. This is used to reference a neuron type, for example in #addNeuron(Object).

      • addSynapseType

        public int addSynapseType(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> config)
        Add a synapse type to this neural network.
        Parameters:
        config - Synapse model-specific configuration parameters, if applicable.
        Returns:
        The index of the new synapse type in this neural network. This is used to reference a synapse type, for example in #addSynapse(Object, int, int).

      • addNeuron

        public abstract int addNeuron(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> config)
        Add a neuron to this neural network.
        Parameters:
        config - Neuron model-specific configuration parameters, if applicable. This will typically contain a "bias" value. If types are used then the config should generally contain a reference to a type according to the values returned by #addNeuronType(Map).
        Returns:
        The index of the new neuron in this neural network. This is used to reference a neuron, for example in #addSynapse(Map, int, int).

      • addSynapse

        public abstract void addSynapse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> config,
              int source,
              int dest)
        Add a synapse to this neural network.
        Parameters:
        config - Synapse model-specific configuration parameters, if applicable. This will typically contain at least a "weight" value. If types are used then the config should generally contain a reference to a type according to the values returned by #addSynapseType(Map).
        source - The index of the source neuron for the synapse, as returned by #addNeuron(Map).
        dest - The index of the destination neuron for the synapse, as returned by #addNeuron(Map).

      • finishedBuilding

        public void finishedBuilding()
        This method should be called by a when the neural network is completed (when there will be no more calls to addNeuron(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Double>) or addSynapse(Map, int, int). Sub-classes may override this method in order to perform any clean-up or other initialisation tasks.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Overrides:
        getStringableMap in class ConfigurableBase
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
